title: Trading Standards Enforcement Action Relating to Underage and Illicit Vape Sales

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
We are conducting some research on behalf of the UK Vaping Industry Association into the level of fines issued and illicit vaping products seized by Trading Standards operations across the country, as well as funding allocations and costs for enforcement of the vape sector. We are particularly interested in understanding the following from you.
In your response, please can you also confirm if we have permission to reuse the information provided for news/reporting purposes and as part of communications with the government, civil servants, industry peers and the general public. We will assume that we are able to use the information in these ways unless you explicitly advise us otherwise in your response.
1.	How many retailers did Sheffield Trading Standards visit on suspicion that they were involved in the sale and supply of illicit/non-compliant vaping products over the past three years?
-	2022
-	2023
-	2024 (to May 31)
2.	How many of the above retailers were specialist dedicated vape shops/online stores versus non-specialist sellers (i.e., convenience stores, supermarkets, kebab/pizza food outlets, barbers, petrol forecourt retailers)?
3.	How many illicit/non-compliant vaping products has Sheffield Trading Standards seized over the past three years?
-	2022
-	2023
-	2024 (to May 31)
4.	What was done with the above illicit/non-compliant vapes once they were seized?
-	Sent to landfill
-	Sent to a recycling centre
-	Destroyed (if yes, please specify how and at what cost to Trading Standards)
-	Exported to their country of origin
-	Exported to another country, but not their location of manufacture
-	Put into storage
-	Other (please specify)
5.	What was the cost of disposal for the illicit/non-compliant vapes seized between 2022 and 2023 and how was this cost met (i.e., was it charged to the offender or paid for by Trading Standards)?
6.	What is the total value of fines that Sheffield Trading Standards has issued to retailers for the sale and/or supply of illicit/non-compliant vaping products over the past three years (please provide the total fine amount for each year)?
-	2022
-	2023
-	2024 (to May 31)
7.	How many online retailers has Sheffield Trading Standards identified as engaging in underage vape sales over the past three years?
-	2022
-	2023
-	2024 (to May 31)
8.	How many physical retailers has Sheffield Trading Standards identified as engaging in underage vape sales over the past three years?
-	2022
-	2023
-	2024 (to May 31)
9.	How many of the above retailers were specialist dedicated vape shops/online stores versus non-specialist sellers (i.e., convenience stores, supermarkets, kebab/pizza food outlets, barbers, petrol forecourt retailers)?
10.	What is the total value of fines that Sheffield Trading Standards has issued to retailers for the sale or supply of vaping products to under 18s over the past three years (please provide the total fine amount for each year)?
-	2022
-	2023
-	2024 (to May 31)
11.	Beyond fines and prosecutions, did sellers identified as engaging in underage or illicit/non-compliant vape sales face any other kind of punitive action (i.e., loss of alcohol licence or store closure)?
12.	What was Sheffield Trading Standards total budget allocation for enforcement (all categories of goods, not just vaping) for the years:
-	2022
-	2023
-	2024
13.	How much has Sheffield Trading Standards spent on inspection/enforcement activities related to vaping for the years:
-	2022
-	2023
-	2024 (to May 31)
14.	Please provide the average cost of the following activities for Sheffield Trading Standards, as it relates to retailers selling vaping products:
-	A routine test purchase attempt
-	A routine raid
-	Issuing a warning/guidance to a retailer
-	Disposal of illegal vaping products
15.	Was Sheffield Trading Standards given any indication as to how much of the government’s £30 million enforcement investment it was to receive. If so, how much did it expect to receive per year?
-	Yes
-	No
-	Expected amount:
Yours faithfully,
Jordan Millar

Dear Jordan Millar,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Trading Standards
Enforcement Action Relating to Underage and Illicit Vape Sales which we
received on 04/07/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. How many retailers did Sheffield Trading Standards visit on suspicion
that they were involved in the sale and supply of illicit/non-compliant
vaping products over the past three years?
- 2022 - 5
- 2023 - 65
- 2024 (to May 31) – 25
2. How many of the above retailers were specialist dedicated vape
shops/online stores versus non-specialist sellers (i.e., convenience
stores, supermarkets, kebab/pizza food outlets, barbers, petrol forecourt
retailers)? 15 specialists / 77 convenience stores
3. How many illicit/non-compliant vaping products has Sheffield Trading
Standards seized over the past three years?
- 2022/23 - 2994
- 2023/24 – 33, 000 +
4. What was done with the above illicit/non-compliant vapes once they were
seized?
- Sent to landfill
- Sent to a recycling centre
- Destroyed (if yes, please specify how and at what cost to Trading
Standards)
- Exported to their country of origin
- Exported to another country, but not their location of manufacture
- Put into storage
- Other (please specify)
5. What was the cost of disposal for the illicit/non-compliant vapes
seized between 2022 and 2023 and how was this cost met (i.e., was it
charged to the offender or paid for by Trading Standards)? – Information
not held. Cost has been paid for from external government funds.
6. What is the total value of fines that Sheffield Trading Standards has
issued to retailers for the sale and/or supply of illicit/non-compliant
vaping products over the past three years (please provide the total fine
amount for each year)?
- 2022 - 0
- 2023 - 0
- 2024 (to May 31) – 0
NB Sheffield operate a disruption model and many thousands of pounds worth
of stock has been seized.
7. How many online retailers has Sheffield Trading Standards identified as
engaging in underage vape sales over the past three years?
- 2022 - 0
- 2023 - 0
- 2024 (to May 31) – 0
8. How many physical retailers has Sheffield Trading Standards identified
as engaging in underage vape sales over the past three years?
- 2022 - 4
- 2023 - 0
- 2024 (to May 31) – 0
9. How many of the above retailers were specialist dedicated vape
shops/online stores versus non-specialist sellers (i.e., convenience
stores, supermarkets, kebab/pizza food outlets, barbers, petrol forecourt
retailers)? 4 convenience stores
10. What is the total value of fines that Sheffield Trading Standards has
issued to retailers for the sale or supply of vaping products to under 18s
over the past three years (please provide the total fine amount for each
year)?
- 2022 - £230 fine + £92 government surcharge and £568 costs
- 2023 - 0
- 2024 (to May 31) – 0
11. Beyond fines and prosecutions, did sellers identified as engaging in
underage or illicit/non-compliant vape sales face any other kind of
punitive action (i.e., loss of alcohol licence or store closure)? – 2 x
loss of alcohol licence
12. What was Sheffield Trading Standards total budget allocation for
enforcement (all categories of goods, not just vaping) for the years:
- 2021/22 £734,800
- 2022/23 £763,055
- 2023/24 £799,622
13. How much has Sheffield Trading Standards spent on
inspection/enforcement activities related to vaping for the years:
- 2022 – No data available
- 2023 – No data available.
- 2023/24, Approx £45,000
14. Please provide the average cost of the following activities for
Sheffield Trading Standards, as it relates to retailers selling vaping
products:
- A routine test purchase attempt - £240
- A routine raid - £696.21
- Issuing a warning/guidance to a retailer - £60
- Disposal of illegal vaping products - £320+VAT to £480+VAT depending on
quantities
15. Was Sheffield Trading Standards given any indication as to how much of
the government’s £30 million enforcement investment it was to receive. If
so, how much did it expect to receive per year?
- Yes
- No
- Expected amount:
